question: 大人しい
sourceMnemonic: Remember how you learned that <ja>大人</ja> means "adult?" Well this is the adjective version of that. The I-adjective (see how it ends in <ja>い</ja>?). What adjective do adults want to be able to use for their own kids? They want to say they are <vocabulary>obedient</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>quiet</vocabulary> kids!
sourceReadingMnemonic: You already learned this reading when you learned <ja>大人</ja>! You should be able to read this too!
